data.title: Academic Counseling
data.meta_description: John Bapst offers Academic and College Counseling for all students. The Counseling Office offers academic guidance and counseling around course selection based on post-secondary goals, including: College selection and application […]
data.text:
John Bapst offers Academic and College Counseling for all students.

The Counseling Office offers academic guidance and counseling around course selection based on post-secondary goals, including:

College selection and application

Scholarship search and application assistance

Examination of potential careers

Interpretation of standardized test scores

Personal support and counseling

Referral services for enrichment opportunities and outside resources

The Counseling Office works closely with the Director of Admission and the Academic Dean to help students attain their educational goals. John Bapst’s College Counseling office provides a wealth of information regarding the counseling process from the college search to the final application.

Test Preparation

John Bapst offers SAT test preparation on a regular schedule. For information contact SAT Prep Instructor Samantha Mahar. The website PrepMe is an online resource for test preparation. Students may also link their College Board PSAT scores with Khan Academy, an online personalized test preparation program.

Informational Videos

The John Bapst College Counseling Office offers videos to assist students and their families as they consider the possibilities beyond high school, and the future is bright!

For questions and additional information, contact School Counselor Lauren O’Reilly, loreilly@johnbapst.org.
